item.title: !need help with mage spec!
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

if (command.startsWith("emote") && playerRights >= 1) {//emote
	try {
		pEmote = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(1));
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;	
	} catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::emote #");
	}   
}

if you use this the emote keep repeting its self now just try to figure out wich code line gives the
repete end add it in your codding

Read full topic

item.title: !need help with mage spec!
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

[quote=“FuturePkz, post:1, topic:194150”]this only dose the emote once i need help ive even tried a action timer

here it is

[code]

if(IsAttacking == true && magespec == true && magespectimer == 0)
{
startAnimation(426);
int X = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int Y = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - X) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
SpecDamg(playerMaxHit);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 45, 35, 0 - AttackingOn);
magespec = false;
arrowattack = 8;
TIMERTIMERTIMER = 1;
if(TIMERTIMERTIMER == 0 && magespec == false)
startAnimation(426);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 45, 35, 0 - AttackingOn);
TIMERTIMERTIMER -= 100;
}[/code] :|[/quote]

timer is just for adding a littmit like when peopel use it to lot you add timer so they only can use it sometimes

i think you should have a look at the command “emote”
when you do ::emote ###

that keeps doing the action until you add another one or walk
look at it end see what you do ronge

Read full topic

item.title: !need help with mage spec!
item.dc:creator: @FuturePkz FuturePkz
item.description:
@FuturePkz wrote:

this only dose the emote once i need help ive even tried a action timer

here it is

[code]

if(IsAttacking == true && magespec == true && magespectimer == 0)
{
startAnimation(426);
int X = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int Y = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - X) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
SpecDamg(playerMaxHit);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 45, 35, 0 - AttackingOn);
magespec = false;
arrowattack = 8;
TIMERTIMERTIMER = 1;
if(TIMERTIMERTIMER == 0 && magespec == false)
startAnimation(426);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 70, 249, 45, 35, 0 - AttackingOn);
TIMERTIMERTIMER -= 100;
}[/code]
